definition[0]: to slide a short distance accidentally, and fall or lose your balance slightly
example[0]: Wright slipped but managed to keep hold of the ball.
definition[1]: to go somewhere, without attracting other people’s attention
example[2]: Ben slipped quietly out of the room.
example[3]: One man managed to slip from the club as police arrived.
definition[2]: to put something somewhere quietly or smoothly

definition[3]: to give someone something secretly or without attracting much attention

example[8]: Carr slips the ball to King who scores easily.
definition[4]: to move smoothly, especially off or from something
example[9]: As he bent over, the towel round his waist slipped.
example[10]: Cally slipped from his grasp and fled.

example[12]: The ring had slipped off Julia’s finger.
definition[5]: if a knife or other tool slips, it moves so that it accidentally cuts the wrong thing

example[15]: His popularity slipped further after a series of scandals.

example[18]: He had begun to slip into debt.
example[19]: She slipped into unconsciousness and died the next day.
definition[8]: to put a piece of clothing on your body, or take it off your body, quickly and smoothly
example[20]: Peter was already at the door slipping on his shoes.
example[21]: She slipped out of her clothes and stepped into the shower.
definition[9]: if time slips away, past etc, it passes quickly

example[23]: The hours slipped past almost unnoticed.
definition[10]: to get free from something that was holding you
example[24]: The dog slipped his collar and ran away.
